title: incredible photo shows moment lightning
story: Incredible photo shows moment lightning bolt strikes house and causes explosionDramatic weather in Ashton-Under-Lynes led to lightning striking the roof of a residential home and causing a blaze in the attic. The shocking moment was captured on cameraLightning can be seen hitting the house roof, causing a fire Image: HandoutByLyell TweedLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan The shocking moment a lightning bolt struck a terraced house causing a fire and explosion was captured in incredible CCTV images. The dramatic images show lightning hitting the roof of a house in Ashton-Under-Lyne.The bolt of light instantly sparked a fire in the attic and neighbouring homes had to be evacuated after the incident at around .am this morning, reports Manchester Evening News. One resident who had to be evacuated told Manchester Evening News: “There was just a massive bang, it honestly sounded like an explosion. “You could instantly see smoke coming from the house and we called the fire service straight away.”  Residents of nearby houses sheltered in the pre-school, which was closed after the incident, after they were evacuated from their homes by the fire service. At least five fire engines quickly attended the scene and shut off the road to deal with the blaze, with police also in attendance. Businesses and homes were left without power for some time while the incident was dealt with. A resident said: “It was such a loud bang, it felt like it shook the house, then before we knew it there were blue lights everywhere. “It’s the last thing you expect to wake up to.”  Another added: “I don’t remember hearing it but it must have woke me up. As I came downstairs all I could see was blue lights and people leaving their homes, it was all quite scary at first I didn’t know what was going on.” The bang could be heard as far away as Oldham according to some on social media. Oliver Driver lives close to the street and said: “Heard it a few streets away and thought it must have been the thunder. Honestly sounded like a bomb went off outside the house though.”Another commented on Facebook saying: “I actually heard this at am from Oldham.“I knew it was bad because I heard sirens straight away. Really surprised that house is still there after how loud it was.”  One side of the roof on the property was completely destroyed with extensive damage inside the attic. Firefighters worked for hours to remove charred debris from the house, including blankets and old books and CDs. Luckily no-one was injured in the blaze, with residents let back into their homes around am. In a statement, a spokesperson from Greater Manchester Fire and Rescue Servicesaid: At approximately am on Friday, th January, firefighters were called to reports of a fire at a terraced property on Store Street, in Ashton-under-Lyne.  “Fire engines from Ashton, Oldham, Stalybridge and Chadderton fire stations, alongside the aerial appliance from Manchester Central station, quickly attended the scene. “The fire involved the roof space of an end terraced house.” Station Manager Ken Booth, officer in charge at the scene, added: Firefighters were called to a fire involving the second floor of an end terrace property. Fire crews have worked to prevent spread to the next-door terrace. The fire has been extinguished.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON CCTVCCTV footageNurseriesWeather" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: inside spooky dilapidated church been
story: Inside spooky dilapidated church that has been left abandoned for over  yearsUrban explorer Steven Kay, from Wigan, sneaked into the Welsh Presbyterian Church, in Liverpool, and took photos of the dilapidated building that has been empty for more than  yearsPhotos of the abandoned church have been taken by an urban explorer Image: OMG ExploringByJonathan HumphriesTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsAn urban explorer has taken some eerie photos of a dilapidated and abandoned Welsh Presbyterian Church in Toxteth, Liverpool.The Grade II listed building in Princes Road has stood empty for more than  years, and the pictures show that it is falling apart with vegetation now growing inside, reported the Liverpool Echo.It is hard to imagine now that it would once have packed congregations and the church would be the centre of a local community. There was work done in  to stabilise the building and money was allocated by the National Lottery to help restore it to its former glory - but that was before the pandemic hit.The photos were taken by urban explorer Steven Kay, a warehouse operative from Wigan, who runs the Youtube channel OMG Explorers where he shares videos from inside abandoned or dilapidated spaces. Steven says urban exploring is a hobby which helps him with his mental health, while he keeps to strict rules. He said: Never damage anything, never steal, never leave a trace or evidence behind. I was driving past the Welsh Presbyterian Church and I thought aposyeah why not, I will seeI can find a way inapos. We found a  with enough space for us to get inside. It was very deteriorated and very damaged. I wonapost say itaposs the worst I have seen but its one of the most deteriorated.  Itaposs a shame that it has been allowed to get like this, but I do understand to a point because its funding. But this is one of the reasons Iaposm glad we have done it, it is documenting whataposs inside in case it collapsed or gets pulled down. In July , the buildingaposs owners, Merseyside Buildings Preservation Trust, were awarded a preliminary grant of £, to drawn up detailed design plans, reported the Liverpool Echo. The grant fuelled hopes that a follow-up cash injection of £.m could lead to a revamp of the former Sunday school and presbytery, along with the rest of the structure, and allow Liverpool charity KIND - Kids in Need and Distress - to move into the revitalised site. news uk-news kate-middleton-ditched-one-thing-"Kate Middleton takes part in lesson at school in HarrowByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan | commentsThe Duchess of Cambridge is often regarded as one of the best-dressed royals as well as being full of poise and elegance. But that wasnapost always the case for Kate, who celebrates her th birthday tomorrow. As a teenager, she is said to have been shy and low in confidence after experiencing a tough time at school. When she was , she left that school and went to the prestigious £,-a-year Malborough College in . School pal Gemma Williamson previously told the Daily Mail: “Apparently she had been bullied very badly and she certainly looked thin and pale. She had very little confidence.”  However, at Marlborough, she sought solace in playing sports and then experienced a sudden turnaround that left every boy in the school rather flustered. And that turnaround is said to have come when Kate ed from the summer break aged . Gemma revealed that, after impressing school pals playing hockey and going cross-country running, the future duchess became “an absolute beauty” and “every boy in the school fancied her rotten”.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Her former teacher, Denise Alford, also revealed that Kate was able to transform her look after losing one key thing - her childhood braces. “Pippa was a tomboy but Kate had lost her braces and looked stunning, she told the Mail. “She was apparently top of the ‘Fit List’ which boys would sometimes pin on the walls.  When Kate left Marlborough with three A-Levels, she embarked on a gap year before deciding to attend St Andrews University, where she met her future husband, Prince William. There Kateaposs self-confidence famously won over William when she wore a see-through dress at a fashion show. In , the then -year-old prince reportedly spent £ for a front-row ticket for the charity fashion show his future we featured in. Here he saw Kate walking the catwalk in a see-through lace dress revealing her black underwear underneath. The duchess is said to have made the transformation from Williamaposs friend to his love interest after he saw her in the fashion show and said: Wow, Kateaposs hot. That started their romance, and now  years on the pair have been married for almost  years and have three gorgeous children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. title: kate middleton planning huge 40th
story: Exclusive: Kate Middleton planning huge th with William as Covid shelves birthday party plansThe Duchess of Cambridge is turning  on Sunday, but is planning to celebrate privately with her family due to the current Covid situation. However, a bigger party could be organised in summerKate Middleton and Prince William could organise a joint birthday party in summer Image: Getty ImagesByRussell MyersRoyal Editor:,  Jan | comments The Duchess of Cambridge could have a joint th birthday party with Prince William, after shelving plans for her own big bash on Sunday.Kate has ditched the idea of a big do this weekend due to the Covid situation. She will instead “celebrate privately with her family”, sources have revealed. The Queen is expected to throw William a party for his own th in June, with Windsor Castle or Sandringham among the likely venues. Similar lavish bashes have previously been thrown to jointly celebrate signicant birthdays of several members of the family at the same time. Back in June  a huge do was held at Windsor to celebrate Prince Andrew’s th birthday, Princess Anne’s th, Princess Margaret’s th and William’s th.  A source told the Mirror: “It’s very much a scaled-down occasion this year for the Duchess, who will celebrate privately with her family. “Of course she is mindful of the current situation. She will be surrounded by loved-ones and that’s all that matters.” Ingrid Seward, editor-in-chief of Majesty Magazine, said she expects the Queen will play a major role in the planning of the party for William.  Ingrid said: “The Queen is tremendously fond of enjoying such occasions and this would be no dferent. “There’s a lot to look forward to in her Platinum Jubilee year, and with both William and Kate turning  it’s an extra excuse to celebrate. “This is a pretty big one for the Cambridges so it should be quite the party.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kensington PalaceKate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgeMeghan MarkleThe QueenAnne, Princess RoyalPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkPrince WilliamRoyal FamilyBirthday partyChristmas partyDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: motorists could landed hefty 2500
story: Motorists could be landed with hefty £, fine for unusual parking ruleWhatCar reports that drivers are banned from parking their cars against the flow of traffic as the reflectors would not be picked up by oncoming vehiclesParking your car the wrong way at night could incur a hefty fine Image: Getty ImagesByLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Jan A little known rule could see motorists slapped with a fine between £, and £, -they park against the flow of traffic at night time. WhatCar, an automobile magazine, reports that drivers are actually banned from parking their cars against the direction of traffic unless there’s a marked out parking space. Even the most disciplined driver could be forgiven for not knowing this unusual fact. The Highway Code lists under Rule  that a car must not be parked at the side of the road facing against the direction of traffic unless in a recognised parking space”. If it is, then you could be breaking the law.This is because parking facing the traffic on unlit roads can be extremely dangerous, according to car scrapping comparison site, scrapcarcomparison. This means it could be harder for other motorists to detect what you are doing, potentially leading to crashes.  Cars parked in the same direction of traffic will have the rear reflectors illuminated. For most vehicles, the offence could cost around £,, whereas for eight-seaters, this jumps to £,. Another sloppy parking habit has seen motorists fined for leaning slightly over the edge of a parking bay - an expensive start to the year and unwelcome surprise after Christmas. Leaving your car stationary in a parking bay should be a fairly straightforward process - but you can actually get finedyou donapost stick to the rules.As the Mirror reported last month, a driver left the side of his car protruding slightly over the bay line in Birmingham City Centre, encroaching on the space next door. He was charged £ for doing so. The fine - which would be reduced to £paid within  days - was issued by private firm Premier Parking Enforcement LTD who are contracted by building management company Remus. title: mum addicted being surrogate expecting
story: Mum addicted to being surrogate expecting th baby says its best job in worldLast year, Laura McCarthy, from Huddersfield, gave birth to someone s twins and is now planning to have her th baby, saying its addictive and the best job in the worldLaura gave birth to twins for another couple in ByHollie BoneNews ReporterAndrew Robinson:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A mum who says being a surrogate is addictive is preparing to have her th baby.Laura McCarthy, , has four children of her own and has carried five others for parents unable to have their own children. After becoming a surrogate for the first time  years ago, the mum of four says the feeling of handing over the baby and seeing the coupleaposs instant and unconditional love for the child can be addictive. All of her surrogate pregnancies have been through in vitro fertilisation , meaning the coupleaposs fertilised egg is implanted in Lauraaposs womb so genetically none of the babies are hers.The single mum from Bradley, Huddersfield, told ExaminerLive : I love being a mum, it’s the best job in the world, and I love that I can help someone fulfil their dream to become a parent. Speaking of the moment she gets to pass the newborn over to the intended parents, she said: Once you see the baby in their arms you can see that unconditional love immediately. It is just so worth it. That feeling can be slightly addictive. Inspired by a TV programme, mum to April, , Rowan, , Ada, six, and Eira, two, decided to become a surrogate for the first time after the births of her first two children. That unconditional love that I felt, I thought how lucky I was to have that and so thoughtI could help others, then why not  Once they are old enough they will know who I am and that they grew in my tummy. She said. A decade on, she recently lost over st so that she could carry on and have a tenth baby for a single man with a donated egg, but is yet to become pregnant.  Laura who now weighs st explained: Having had nine babies, and definitely wanting more, I couldn’t risk a tenth baby whilst being so overweight because of the associated risk factors. Before starting the process, Laura gets to know the intended parents she is working with and stays in touch afterwards, adding that when the children are old enough they will be told how they were born. Once they are old enough they will know who I am and that they grew in my tummy. Laura adds. However there are misconceptions around surrogacy Laura says, including myths that surrogates make lots of money and concerns that they will become attached to the baby. People think I would be attached to the baby. Of course, I want to keep that baby safe, but you donapost have the same feelingstowards your own child when you are pregnant with someone aposs. She says.  Under UK law, surrogates cannot be paid except for reasonable expenses such as clothes and medication. In the UK, surrogacy is altruistic. Expenses are covered, such as travel and maternity clothes. Laura says, adding that some people ask funny questions like aposdo you know who you are doing it for apos. Yes, I would not have a baby for a stranger. she answers. But there are some concerns more personal to Laura as the number of children she has given birth to approaches double figures. Laura said: I do get asked that. It is a sensible question.  I would like to carry on helping people to have their family. If my body gets to the stage where it is struggling with pregnancy, orI get health problems or the birth is not going well, that is where a line will need to be drawn because my children need a mum.I never rule anything out, I play everything by ear. I have always coped well with pregnancy and have had straightforward births. Despite some initial shock and concern from her grandparents over her first surrogate baby, Laura says she has the full backing of her family, who would be surprisedshe stopped. Itaposs so normal to my family they would be shockedI wasnapost having more...my mum is my biggest support regarding surrogacy. She supports me in doing what I do. She added: Twelve years ago, when I first started to do it, they had a lot of misconceptions. They were a little bit shocked and thought I shouldnapost do it. They saw an amazing journey with the parents and how they were respectful of me. title: mum who weighed 17st sheds
story: Mum who weighed st sheds an incredible st in  months after hating how she lookedNikki Panner had tried many dferent diets in the past but never found one that worked for her as she hadnt taken the time to cook for herself and her familyNikki has shed an incredible six stone Image: Nikki Panner Slimming WorldByRachael DavisGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA mum shed an incredible six stones in eight months. after hating how she looked. Nikki Panner weighed more than  stonesand was unhappy in her own skin. She was desperate for some lovely pictures with her then-three-month-old daughter, but hated seeing herself. The -year-old mum had struggled with her weight and couldnapost look at herself.Nikki told MyLondon she had tried dferent diets and struggled to find one which worked for her.She said: I remember that Christmas We were taking photos, and I just did not like myself. In one photo, I hated myself in it. Iaposd been struggling with my weight for a few years at that point, I just wanted to feel happy.Following a suggestion from her mum, Nikki signed up to her local Slimming World group to begin her weight loss journey.Sheaposd tried many dferent diets in the past but never found one that worked for her, partly because sheaposd never really taken the time to cook for herself and her family, or spend time preparing nutritious, tasty meals. I barely cooked before, I never really took the time to, she explained. I [also] wasnapost really active at that point: Iaposd had a C-section and I had quite a bad recovery, so I couldnapost be too active. But I had time in the evening where I was able to just cook, so I found loads of Slimming World recipes that had what we call aposfree foodapos. I spent that time for myself cooking dinner for my family. Slimming Worldaposs aposfree foodsapos are healthy staples that make up the bulk of a nutritious meal, and members are encouraged to eat as much aposfree foodapos as they like, until they feel full. They include things like lean meat and meat replacements, fish, dairy, eggs, pasta, rice, potatoes, vegetables and fruit - the main healthy food groups that are incorporated into a balanced meal. Nikki, from Hillingdon, west London, said: It was just small changes in the foods I was eating, the way I prepared food, and it just fit into my lestyle. They were average meals that weaposd have every day beforehand, but I learned how to cook them better. I started to really enjoy it, to learn [how to cook], it taught me a lot long-term and changed the way I looked at food. No foods are banned, so I never felt like I was restricted, she added. When I joined [Slimming World] I was breastfeeding, and obviously I needed extra calcium and fibre so Slimming World added that into my plans, I never felt like I had to give up or sacrice anything - I could even have a chocolate barI needed to. As Nikki started to sht the pounds through enjoying a balanced diet of nutritious, filling meals - and still enjoying the odd treat to avoid unsustainable, restrictive dieting - she felt able to be more active and found it easier to move more. She began walking with her daughter as a relaxed way to exercise, and appreciated not feeling forced to go to the gym or endure strenuous exercise by her slimming plan. Her weight loss didnapost feel real until she saw photos of herself after losing around five stone. She noticed a stark dference in how she looked compared to the photos she hated from Christmas, and started to feel more confident in her own skin. After reforming her diet in January , by August Nikki had lost six stone, or  kilograms. This hasnapost only transformed her body image, but also her family le: losing the weight helped Nikki, who has polycystic oy syndrome , conceive her second child. Getting pregnant is dficult for people with PCOS, and one of the main symptoms of the condition is weight gain, which can make it even harder. Losing so much weight is, therefore, a twofold success for Nikki, who feels happier and healthier while getting ready to welcome another child into the world. My doctors said it was going to be really dficult for me [to get pregnant], but I think losing the weight really helped, she said.Iaposm already noticing a dference in this pregnancy : Iaposm going up the stairs so much quicker, I just feel more active, which is really nice.While Nikki continues her new lestyle, sheaposs also about to embark on a new career as a Slimming World consultant, helping other people achieve their goals - she couldnapost be more excited about her new job, or more proud of how far sheaposs come. news uk-news prince-andrews-final-bid-end-"Prince Andrew addresses Virginia Giuffre’s allegations in ByRussell MyersRoyal EditorChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  Desperate Prince Andrew is plotting a last-ditch bid to have the civil rape case against him thrown out as it was claimed his accuser will refuse any offer of an out-of-court settlement.Virginia Giuffre, who alleges she was forced to have sex with Andrew when she was , is said to want a trial to send a message that anyone “with power and privilege” accused of abusing young girls will face justice. New York judge Lewis Kaplan’s decision on whether the Duke will face a full civil trial is expected soon. He has already decided there is no case to answer on the “domicile ­argument” over Ms Giuffre’s residency in Australia but a source has told the Mirror that Andrew’s legal team “are not taking this lying down”.  His lawyers believe they have found a new angle to stop Ms Giuffre’s case, as federal law explicitly bans two parties who are not US residents facing each other in court. The source said: “They believe they have a genuine argument to get this thrown out. If they can prove under federal law where Ms Giuffre has filed her case, that there is precedent not to bring a case where both parties are not US residents, then it should be halted immediately.” Ms Giuffre, who claims she was trafficked by billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein and his partner Ghislaine Maxwell, and forced to have sex with the Duke on three occasions in , has lived in Australia since . Our source said: “Eventhe judge rules that there is a case for a full trial, there is a long way to go.”  The Duke’s attorney, Andrew Brettler, said Ms Giuffre was living in a £million home in Perth, Australia, when she filed her lawsuit and had spent less than two years in the US since moving to Australia in . The claimant’s team has a deadline of January  to prove -year-old Ms Giuffre’s residency status. Prince Andrew’s former we Sarah, , today declared it was “onwards and upwards” as she ed from a skiing holiday in Verbier, Switzerland, at the £million chalet the Duke is having to sell to pay his legal bills, which have topped £million. The Duke has always “absolutely and categorically” denied the allegations against him. But the Queen will not pay her son’s costs and “would not assist” him in paying a financial ­settlement to Ms Giuffre.  It has been claimed a million – £.million – out of court settlement would be turned down by Ms Giuffre, leaving the Duke at risk of a far higher payouther case goes ahead in the autumn and is settled by a jury. Previously, Spencer Kuvin, a lawyer for some of Epstein’s victims, told the MirrorAndrew is found guilty the damages could “easily” top £million. He said: “A jury is not limited by anything. To punish somebody worth a billion dollars, you have got to hit them in their pockets and punish them accordingly.” If Judge Kaplan does decide that the case should go to trial, insiders have said the option to settle out of court “remains on the table”. One source said: “No discussions have been had regarding a financial settlement – the Duke wants to clear his name. “This is a US civil litigation, being fought in a US court with US lawyers – and given that the vast majority of US civil litigation is settled out of court, it would always remain an option on the table.” Read MoreRead MoreFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Ghislaine MaxwellPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyCrimeBillionairesDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: schoolgirl 8 rare condition dreams
story: Schoolgirl, , with rare condition dreams of walking down the aisle as a bridesmaidThere is now new hope for Amelie after she was offered le-changing surgery that will give her the best chance of walking unaided and without her walking frameAmelie Round has Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia Image: Mercury Press  MediaByChloe CawoodGraeme Murray:,  Jan | commentsA schoolgirl with a rare condition wants to fulfil her dream of walking down the aisle as a bridesmaid. Amelie Round was diagnosed with Hereditary Spastic Paraplegia- which affects her lower body muscles, causing them to be tight and weak - four years ago. After years of struggling, there is now new hope for Amelie as she has been offered le-changing surgery in Missouri, US, that will give her the best chance of walking unaided - but the family need £,. The eight-year-old dreams of being able to walk independently and joining her sister, Saphie, four, as a bridesmaid for her parents. Her parents, Rose Moore,  and Jay Round,  of Hessay, York, plan to renew their wedding vows for their ten-year anniversary after the operation. Rose said: “After the surgery, the hope is the girls would be bridesmaids. “Amelie could independently walk down the aisle, which is something she couldn’t do now.” The pair were delighted when they welcomed their first child into the world eight years ago.  Until Amelie was -months old, they believed their daughter was developing perfectly. However Amelie did not walk like her other friends and appeared to be very unsteady on her feet, prompting a long road of tests and invasive investigations. By age four, she was given the devastating diagnosis of a lelong motor neurone condition known as HSP. Rose said: “Itaposs a rare condition that affects only around .% of the population The condition affects her lower body muscles, causing them to be tight and weak. “It makes it incredibly dficult for her to walk and balance is a real struggle,I leave her for a second, she just falls. “She also has weak motor skills. There isn’t really one thing which is easy for her.” After the news and arrival of their second child, Saphie, Amelie and Jay felt overwhelmed and as they adapted their lives and home to Amelie’s needs. The pandemic also had a signicant effect on the family and Rose had to give up her job as a solicitor to take care of the girls. Rose said: “It’s really exhausting because we have to watch her constantly. “There’s the emotional side too. It’s really hard watching her struggle.” Although she attends four physiotherapy sessions a week, the eight-year-old lives in constant pain. Rose said: “She gets upset because she doesn’t understand why she has to do her stretches. “She doesn’t understand why her mummy is making her do something that hurts her.”  Because her condition is so rare, Amelie’s parents struggled to find much information online. Rose said: “After the diagnosis we joined so many online forums and support groups to ask questions. “I don’t know what we would have done without them.” Every day, Amelie has to use a walking frame and wears ankle splints. This exhausts her and she struggles signicantly to play with her friends and little sister, who she adores. Amelie is sadly not eligible for this surgery in the UK, however Dr Park in St Louis Childrenaposs Hospital, Missouri is confident the operation will change her le for the better. Rose said: “For a lot of children it’s absolutely le changing and has miraculous results. “Ultimately it’s going to sever the nerves in her spinal cord – the ones that are telling the muscles to be tight in her legs.” “There will be a long rehabilitation process afterwards, but we are hopeful and optimistic.” However, the procedure is costly. Dozens of generous donors have contributed to a GoFundMe page for the brave girl. £, is needed to fund the procedure and give Amelie the opportunity to live her le as independent as possible. Her family are now hoping to raise money to give their young daughter this chance of to transform her le. So far, nearly £, has been raised and the family are overwhelmed with the support and generosity of their friends. To reach their goal, the eight-year-old’s family and friends plan to participate in some active fundraisers in Spring. Rose said: “We like to do a lot of community-based stuff and things Amelie can be involved in.” “We even want to do a danceathon then Amelie can join in in her own way” “She would love to perform in a dance show one day.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsWeddings" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: scientists investigate people keep getting
story: Scientists investigate why some people keep getting Covid while others never fall illIt emerged this week that Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer had tested positive for coronavirus - despite the fact that hed already had the virus in OctoberScenes at Londons Kings Cross Station this week Image: Ben Cawthra LNPByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Jan | commentsScientists have been investigating why some people get Covid multiple times while others seem able to keep dodging the virus despite exposure.It emerged this week that Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has tested positive for coronavirus - despite the fact that heaposd had the virus in October.Meanwhile others who have been in contact with positive cases have reported managing to escape a positive result. Sir John Bell, regius professor of medicine at Oxford University, said some people may have already had a background level of protection against coronavirus.He told The Sun : I think they are present in quite a signicant number of people.So there is probably background T-cell immunity in people before they see the coronavirus, and that may be relevant that many people get a pretty asymptomatic disease.Those T-cells get a bit tired once youaposre beyond the age of  and may not be as effective at removing a virus, so that may explain a number of dferent features of the disease. Researchers in the UK and Brazil are reportedly studying whether it is possible some people might have a natural immunity which allows their immune systems to fight the virus.  A professor of medicine and immunology at Imperial College London, Danny Altmann, says the genes that control our immunity dfer hugely from one person to another.Referring to immunity, he told The : I’m talking about thousands of possibilities on your chequerboard no two people will ever look the same.One theory as to why some people may have natural immunity is that people could have been exposed to similar viruses before in the past, reports said. When T-cells learn how to fight a similar virus, it is believed they become better at fighting others. Some scientists suspect some people may just be born with immunity to certain viruses but this idea is less well researched and there is no clear evidence for this yet. Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer tested positive for coronavirus a day after a major speech setting out his vision for Britainaposs future. Sir Keir missed Prime Ministeraposs Questions, with deputy leader Angela Rayner stepping in to face Boris Johnson. The Labour leader previously tested positive for coronavirus on the day of the Budget in October.Sir Keir is not thought to have any Covid- symptoms but the infection was picked up as part of his regular testing routine. This latest positive test will mean it is the sixth period of self-isolation for the Labour leader since the start of the pandemic. A Labour spokesman said Sir Keir had been taking regular lateral flow tests. title: teaching assistant sacked humiliating boy
story: Teaching assistant sacked for humiliating boy by calling him girls name during PEJohn Brelsford also allegedly called pupils at St Wilfrid’s Primary School, Sheffield, stupid and pathetic during his classes and screamed and shouted at themA student was left in tears after being humiliated by a teacher Image: PAByJames RodgerRegional Content EditorLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Jan A teaching assistant has been sacked after humiliating a boy by giving him a girls’ name during a PE lesson in front of classmates. John Brelsford embarrassed the vulnerable child at St Wilfrid’s Primary School, Sheffield, who was left “crying” after the incident.During the lesson, Mr Brelsford split his class by gender, and then asked some of the boys to switch sides to create equal teams, reports BirminghamLive. The teaching assistant then gave one of the boys a female name, and branded him a baby when he got upset. He had previously called pupils stupid and pathetic, aposscreamedand shouted at them. The then headteacher Delia Evans said: I am concerned that John doesn’t see that his conduct is unprofessional and what he is doing wrong, despite previous training and warnings. Employment Judge Chris McAvoy-Newns threw out the claim of unfair dismissal.  He added: I find that [Mr Brelsford] was dismissed for conduct and not because Mr Truby or Mrs Evans held a personal vendetta towards him. Although there are some suggestions that Mr Truby was losing patience with him a long time before January , had there been such a vendetta, I find that it is likely that they would have escalated the dismissal process much more quickly than they did. There were a signicant amount of incidents concerning [Mr Brelsford] from February . These concerned [his] behaviour towards children, in particular, the way he spoke to or interacted with them... Although none of the incidents giving rise to the disciplinary warnings were precisely the same, they all followed the same theme and concerned [Mr Brelsfordaposs] conduct with children which the [school] considered to be inappropriate. title: teenager 16 left suicidal after
story: Teenager, , left suicidal after slipping and having hand sliced off by moving trainTyler Finnigan suffered le-changing injuries when he accidentally slipped onto the tracks at Motherwell train station - he was only  when he had to have his arm amputatedTyler is desperate the live an independent le Image: Daily RecordByKaitlin EastonReporterAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA teenager who suffered serious injuries in a train accident has been left suicidal and desperate to live an independent le. Tyler Finnigan suffered le-changing injuries when he accidentally slipped onto the tracks at Motherwell train station in April last year. He was only  when he had to have his arm amputated after his hand was sliced off by the moving train.The teen, from Scotland, also suffered such severe head trauma that he was placed in an induced coma at Queen Elizabeth University, the Daily Record reports. Doctors put  staples into his wound and also saved his right ear by sewing it back on.  Tyler, now , has suffered severe mental health issues and has contemplated taking his own le since the accident. He is also devastated by the loss of his independence and haunted by traumatic night terrors. Dad Kevin, , is now trying to raise funds to buy him a state-of-the-art prosthetic arm to improve his quality of le. Tyler does not have enough bone in his limb to be able to use an NHS-issued prosthetic. Tyler said: I struggle with le on a daily basis. I canapost dress myself or tie my own shoelaces.  I need help getting in and out of the shower. I canapost do simple things, like cut up a potato or butter bread. The worst part is going outside because Iaposm so paranoid everyone is staring at me. I take panic attacks whenever I hear a train and I have night terrors about the accident. I feel like all my friends have abandoned me and Iaposm in constant pain. Iaposve contemplated suicide, but all I want is my independence - more independence than I have now. Getting a prosthetic arm that would help me do that, it would mean the world to me. Tyler had been looking forward to starting a mechanics course the week after his accident but his plans for the future became impossible as a result of his injuries. Kevin is desperate to help his son and is trying to raise money for an articial limb that works by recording electric signals - and they can cost up to £k. UK-based prosthetics firm Otto Bock currently offers the technology privately but the cost is priced per patient. Their articial limb, DynamicArm, is similar to others available in America made by companies such as Open Bionics and Mobius Bionics. The security guard said: Tyler has been struggling with his mental health and has been really low. It is heartbreaking for me to see him like this and feel like there is nothing I can do. A prosthetic arm that works will make a massive dference to his le. Iaposm concerned about his mental state of mind, he feels like Iaposve got to help him wash and get dressed. He gets so frustrated that he canapost put on his own shoes. Getting him this arm is so important, itaposll help him regain his independence. Iaposve been working all through Christmas to save as much as I can. Iaposve got epilepsy so Iaposm meant to be off sick as I still have seizures. But I want to see my boyaposs quality of le back again. Iaposll keep going until he gets the arm. We just need to take each day as it comes.Donations to help Tyler get the prosthetic arm can be made here. *If youaposre struggling and need to talk, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . news uk-news uk-rules-out-th-covid-"Omicron hospital admission % less likely after booster says JavidByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments UK health officials have ruled out a fourth Covid vaccine as booster jabs are still providing the highest levels of protection.Three months after receiving a third jab, protection against hospitalisation among those aged  and over remained at about %, according to the UK Health Security Agency. The data is highly encouraging and emphasises the value of a booster jab, Wei Shen Lim, chair for COVID- immunisation on the governmentaposs Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation, said in a statement.By comparison, with only two vaccine doses, protection against severe disease for the over-s dropped to around % after three months and to % after six months, the UKHSA said.The current data show the booster dose is continuing to provide high levels of protection against severe disease, even for the most vulnerable older age groups, Lim said.  For this reason, the committee has concluded there is no immediate need to introduce a second booster dose, though this will continue to be reviewed. Protection against mild symptomatic infection was more short-lived than against severe disease and dropped to around % after about three months, the UKHSA said. Israel is now administering fourth doses to people over  and health workers, as well as immunocompromised patients, after finding they boost antibodies five-fold within a week.It comes as Covid cases have risen by , in a % decrease over the past seven days.Todayaposs figures show a further  deaths have also been recorded in the last  hours.  It comes after last Friday, New Yearaposs Eve, saw , infections recorded and  deaths.Earlier today, it was announced the the UKaposs Covid R rate was as high as . in a huge weekly jump.An R number between . and . means that for every  people infected, they will on average infect between  and  other people. It is the first update to the R number since December , following a break for Christmas, when the range was . to .. The daily growth of infections is estimated at between % and %. title: we must find out famous
story: We must find out why famous names were in Ghislaine Maxwells address bookThe contents of Ghislaine Maxwells little black book were kept secret at her trial, but its contents should be properly scrutinised, says Paul RoutledgeJeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell Image: Patrick McMullan via Getty ImagesopinionByPaul Routledge:,  Jan Prince Andrew ’s lawyers played a Get-Out-Of-Jail card to get him off the hook. The final outcome of his case is not yet known, but what fascinates me is sex offender Ghislaine Maxwell ’s little black book.As our brilliant US Editor Christopher Bucktin disclosed,  Brits appear in this secret contact directory. US law officials are reviewing more than , phone numbers and dozens of email addresses in search of further evidence. There are no allegations of wrongdoing against any of those named. There’s nothing criminal about appearing in somebody’s contacts book. When I was a political correspondent, mine contained the private details of Tory MPs and ministers. That didn’t make me one of them.But there was traffic. I would call them for a story, a quote or some background information. They were in there for a reason. The FBI sees these named Brits, including some lords and ladies, merely as “potential witnesses, unless the evidence leads them ­where”.Fair enough. But what are Tony Blair, mentioned once, and  of his former Cabinet members, doing in the little black book  Why is Lord Peter Mandelson in there with “home” and “country home” phone numbers This list tells me rich, powerful and influential people, from pop stars to presidents and politicians to princes, rubbed shoulders in an international Establishment of “the beautul people”. Lawyers at Maxwell’s sex trafficking trial agreed the little black book should not be made public. Nonsense. It already has been, at a case involving Prince Andrew’s rape accuser Virginia Giuffre. Let’s open this Who’s Who of the jet set, and ask them why they were persons of interest to Maxwell and her dead lover, paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. Plan B doomed to fail The reality of the Government’s Plan B to combat surging Omicron transmission is now clear. It is an abdication of ministerial responsibility, a Do-It-Yourself strategy for the population, with these rules: Buy more masks, and wear them at all times, unless appearing on TV to save the Prime Minister’s face. Don’t go to the office, work from home, whether you get paid or not. Do get yourself vaccinated to boost the Tories’ flagging political fortunes. Don’t party with pals, except in work-related gatherings exempt from the rules, with permission from Downing Street. Travel abroad irresponsibly to facilitate the import of new virus iants. On demand, show your Covid pass to anyone in authority. These rules will be reviewed regularly to avoid a lockdown that would save lives, but upset the Covidiot wing of the Conservative Party. Any inquiries should be made to the Department of Lateral Flow Testing, Notmeguv House, Whitehall.  aposLevelling upapos So that’s what the Government means by “levelling up”. It’s about filling in potholes for former Tory peers. Viscount Pothole – I’m sorry, Gage – , got a £, grant from the Getting Building Fund to do up the driveway to his Firle Estate in East Sussex. Building back better! I hope his stately home doesn’t need redecorating because the Boris Wallpaper Finance Fund is running low. title: woman blinded 3 days after
story: Woman blinded for  days after horror stables fall left her looking like a goldfishAbbi Diamond, , split her forehead in half after falling in the horse stables, leaving her blind for nearly three days. Now she is urging others to wear their riding hat when handling a horseAbbis eyes ballooned so rapidly she was left temporarily blind Image: Kennedy News and MediaBySophie NorrisLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Jan A horse-rider was left with enormous golf ball eyes after a horror stables fall saw her split her forehead in half. Abbi Diamond, , was feeding her Dutch Warmblood horse, called Blue, when she tripped on uneven ground and hit her head on the kerb in December. Her eyes ballooned so rapidly she was left temporarily blind with golf ball eyes like a goldfish. Stable owners rushed Abbi, who is from Edinburgh, Scotland, to AE where the bone-deep cm cut needed  stitches. Concerned doctors warned the administrator that she will be left permanently scarred by the freak accident. Now Abbi is warning others to wear a helmet at all times while handling horses, as she continues to recover from the traumatic experience. Abbi said: It was a normal day. I got up to go to the horse and sheaposs currently unwell, so sheaposs on box rest.  I was holding on to her lead rope and I lost my footing, I tripped on a pot hole or something and I fell. Blue can be quite flighty so I didnapost let go of her, so didnapost put my hands out to protect my face, and my whole face went straight into the kerb.” Abbi has owned the -year-old horse for four years and has won awards in show jumping competitions with her. She never thought she would sustain such a serious injury away from the arena. Now she has been left unable to feel her forehead entirely and is waiting to see the long-term damage left by the fall. Abbi said: It was really deep. I was dying to see what it looked like properly so my mum took a picture while I was sat in AE waiting for it to be stitched up. It was a deep gash from one brow straight into the other one. It went down to my eyelid as well and I have  stitches in there. There wasnapost any surgery but they gave me anaesthetic, though I couldnapost really feel anything anyway.” It took staff around forty minutes to stitch up, and the plastic surgeon checked all of her movements. Abbi had both eyes closed for two or three days and feared her sight may never . She added: I looked like a goldfish with golf ball eyes. A few of my friends have kindly said I look like an ant too.” I still donapost have feeling in my forehead but Iaposm hoping that will come back.” After three days, one of Abbiaposs eyes finally started to go down and she was able to film some videos for her followers to explain what had happened. Now she is sharing her story to warn other horse riders to stay safe even while off their horse - urging them to wear hats even when they think they are safely on the ground. Abbi said: One eye slightly opened and thataposs how I managed to make the TikToks and explain what was going on. Itaposs had about .million views which is almost the population of Scotland.  [Medical staff] said there would be a scar and it would affect my eyebrows. That was a bit of a worry as Iaposm into my make up. Even [when Iaposm] not wearing make up Iaposm a girly girl. I might have to get my eyebrows tattooed on or draw them on every day. The chances of injury when out show-jumping were high, but I never thought it would happen now. Since her accident, Abbi has resolved to stay optimistic and still hopes to ride her beloved Blue again in the future. Abbi said: Iaposd tell people to make sure they wear the correct footwear and even a hat. A lot of people donapost put their hat on while handling their horse on the ground, you just think everything will be fine. If Iaposd worn a hat my injury wouldnapost be as bad. Iaposm hoping to get back on board, Iaposm desperate to get on.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Horses" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news unvaxxed-couple-married--years-"Omicron Covid iant: Symptoms to look out forByLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A husband and we who were married for more than four decades died from Covid  seconds apart while holding hands. William Stewart, , and we Carol, , who were both unvaccinated, had been hospitalised after eight members of their family tested positive for Covid .The couple, from New Hampshire in the US were on le support for eight days, and two weeks, respectively, during which Mr Stewart suffered from lung, kidney and renal failures due to Covid complications.Their devastated family were initially only allowed to see them remotely using iPads but were allowed to gather around their beds, dressed head-to-toe in protective gear, as they both took their last breaths. Melissa Noke, one of the couple’s daughters, told the Boston Globe that her parents were inseparable and the true definition of apossoul matesapos. She explained how the hospital staff wheeled her parentsapos bed into the same room so they could die together. “Placed both beds side by side, placing my mother’s hand into my father’s hand,” she told WMUR. “As soon as they touched hands, my father took his last breath, and then my mother  seconds later.” Mrs Noke said her parents first met when Mr Stewartaposs mum babysat for Carol who was just four at the time. They lost contact but reconnected as adults, and within a year fell in love and got married before going on to have three daughters Melissa, Malissa and Melinda. They have also left behind seven grandchildren.  Mrs Noke said is planning to get the Covid jab and is urging others to so the same so they don’t have to endure the pain her parents went through in their final days. She said: “I just want people to get vaccinated, because you never know what tomorrow is going to bring. We want to spread the story as much as possible about their love story, and what happened to them.  Before the couple died on December  a crowdfundraiser was launched by their nephew Tim Stewart to pay for their medical bills as they did not have health insurance.He said in a post announcing their deaths, he wrote: They fought a long and hard battle with Covid, both intubated and on le support. We never really have enough time with our loved ones. news weird-news grieving-woman-mortied-after-texting-"TikTok user texts her sisters old number after her deathByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA grieving woman who recently lost her sister comforted herself by texting her siblingaposs number - but it had been reassigned and she got a cruel response from the new owner.Faith Sidman shared a video to TikTok, where she uploads to the account @faithsidman, saying how for two years she has sent messages to her sister, saved as aposSissyapos in her phone. Then she text her in July, and wrote aposthinking about you lots today, I love youapos - and was shocked when she got a reply, asking her to stop texting, as the Daily Star reports. It emerged that the telephone number had been reassigned to a business and it appears the owner had no sympathy for Faith. What do you think about the companyaposs reply  Let us know in the comments... Faith shared a video that included screenshots of the conversation, and the first one to the number was on July . On July , a text was sent back that bluntly reads: You have the wrong number. Faith replies with: Iaposm sorry, my sister passed away two years ago and I still text her from time to time. I thought the number was out of service, I wonapost text anymore.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Ignoring Faithaposs apology and heartbreaking explanation, the person texts back: This was a business. Please stop texting. The video has been watched more than . million times since Faith uploaded it on Wednesday, January , with the caption: At least I got to see her name pop up on my phone one last time. One viewer was horried and commented: I just know your heart dropped seeing her name pop up...I’m sorry baby. A second told her: I could only imagine the emotions when you saw ‘she’ texted you back and to open up the message to them being snarky. I’m so sorry. I would have sent the coldest, nastiest message back, wrote a third, Someone  commented: They could’ve just blocked you so you can keep texting. Meanwhile, other users said Faith should out the company in question so they would have the opportunity to complain. Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: im forensic psychologist im amazed
story: Im a forensic psychologist and Im amazed by how many people are actually psychopathsA forensic psychologist has taken to the internet answer any burning questions users may have about their profession, offering a glimpse into their sometimes disturbing working dayA forensic psychologist has shared secrets of the jobImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByJulia Banim:,  Jan | commentsAs far as professions go, the career path of a forensic psychologist surely has to rank among the most intriguing, with practitioners in this field gaining unparalleled insight into the darker recesses of the human mind. Itaposs no great surprise therefore that, after one forensic psychologist from the US took to Redditaposs Ask Me Anything forum, they were bombarded with questions about the more disturbing aspects of their job.Curious commenters were certainly not left disappointed, with the aposrelatively newapos professional opening up candidly about their line of work with all types of clients - including those who have committed murder. The unnamed inidual says they currently work at a conditional release program that provides therapy, case management and evaluations for those with severe mental illness.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. They explain these patients have previously been committed to the state hospital on account of the dangerousness of their offence and their aim is to bring them safely back into society. One of the main questions Reddit users had was whether or not people were aposevilapos by nature or because of apossociety parenting circumstancesapos. The forensic psychologist, who writes under the username u hippokuda, stated that they believe both things to be true, going on to address the dferences between psychopathy and sociopathy. They wrote: If you look at apospsychopathsapos vs apossociopathsapos thataposs an example of innate vs environment. Psychopathy is something people are born with and we can see neurological dferences that inhibit their ability to empathize with people. Whereas someone who is a apossociopathapos is not inherently born with it and behave in a way that could be a product of their environment . And you can see that they are able to empathize and have connections with people, but perhaps shaped in an antisocial lens. However, they went on to say they believe that even for the psychopaths itaposs still both, remarking that not everyone with psychopathy is a serial killer. Some of them participate in our society in socially acceptable ways . Even when you look at a lot of serial killers youaposll see that a lot of them have pretty signicant histories of trauma and abuse, they explained.For this particular forensic psychologist, the realisation that psychopathy can be found in aposeveryday peopleapos is the most interesting thing theyaposve learned so far, with the user remarking that they are always startled by just how aposnormalapos a lot of my clients present. They add that even when meeting people outside of work, they now canapost help but wonder how many gnarly people are out there that are flying under the radar.No doubt many of those whoaposve read the thread will now feel the same way. Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: im uninviting cousins wedding leaking
story: Im uninviting my cousins from my wedding for leaking info to my estranged mumA man has uninvited his cousins from his wedding after discovering theyd been sending information about him to his mum, who he hasnt spoken to since he was The man hasnt spoken to his mum since he was  Image: Getty Images WestendByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A groom-to-be has revealed how heaposs uninvited his own cousins from his wedding, after discovering theyaposd been leaking information about him to his estranged mum.The -year-old, who has no brothers or sisters, hasnapost spoken to his mum since he was a teen after she had an affair, and has cut ties with the whole family, with the exception of a couple of cousins.Iaposm an only child and when I was  my parents orced when my dad found out my mum cheated on him. This was devastating to my dad as my parents were best friends and started dating when they were , the man explained on Redditaposs AITA forum.I played sports and my dad was my coach so I had a much closer relationship to him then my mum. I was supposed to spend one week at my mumaposs then the next week at my dads. But I would usually just lock myself in my room at my mumaposs. Usually my dad would drop me off and I would get on my bike and ride the couple miles back to his house.  He added: My mum would ask me things and I would literally pretend like she didn’t exist. It got so bad that lawyers got involved thinking my dad was turning me against my mum. My dad encouraged me to spend time with my mum, but I couldn’t. My mum tried putting us in therapy but I would just sit there till the time was up not saying a word to her. Eventually my mum broke down and let me just live with my dad. The man hasnapost spoken to his mum since he as  and would even ask his dad to get her to leaveshe turned up to watch his games. She would try to speak to him at the end of matches and he would walk right past her without even acknowledging. I cut her whole family off besides a few of my cousins that were around my age. She showed up to my high school graduation and I asked a couple teachers to remove her and they did. She never dated anyone  to my knowledge and was still attempting to reconcile with my dad a few years before he passed, calling it the aposbiggest mistake of her leapos and begging my dad to forgive her, he continued. When my dad passed a couple years ago she tried to show up to the funeral and I met her outside to ask her to leave. My fiancée Rachel was with me when I did this and my mum cried after learning we were engaged saying she couldn’t believe I hated her still this many years later. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Last week the man received a letter from his mum with a large cheque inside. In the letter she told him she couldnapost live with herself not being invited to her only sonaposs wedding and that the whole family is so upset theyaposve cut off. She also told him sheaposd been keeping tabs on him via his cousins. I ripped the cheque up and sent it back to theaddress. She shouldn’t have even known my address as I keep her blocked on all social media. I called up my cousins who admitted that since I was  they have been providing my mum with updates on me prom pics, college updates, engagement photos and they sent her my address, he continued. I was so mad that I told them they wouldn’t be invited to the wedding anymore because I don’t want my mum getting access to it. Rachel is saying I’m going too far now and uninviting my cousins along with freezing out my mumaposs whole family because of her actions is an a**hole move. The man to Reddit to question whether he was taking it too far by uninviting his cousins. Acting out as a -year-old is to be expected. Deciding not to ever forgive your mum is totally your right , one Reddit user commented. The fact that you are still throwing tantrums like a -year-old, at the age of , makes you the a**hole. Another added: Why are you punishing your mum so severely  She made an awful mistake years ago, a mistake many parents do. They have a right to their own lives and moral failings. Honestly I would encourage you to explore why you feel this hatred for your mum that seems disproportionate. Punishing your cousins for showing compassion does seem like going too far.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. ALTERNATES s _Croyde.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| commentsLike many couples that appear on Grand Designs, Edward and Hazel short inspired us with their elaborate plans to build a wildly ambitious family home. The incredible home at Down End Point, a renowned beauty spot in North Devon, would see them make a drastic jump from their busy lives in London., with daughters Nicole and Lauren. And it wasnapost any ordinary style home . The five-bedroom house includes a four-storey tower from which inhabitants can gaze across the sea. It was set to include a further four bedrooms in the main body of the house, a sauna, a cinema and a ft glass-edged infinity pool with views over Croyde Bay. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Like every episode of Grand Designs, this one began with a sombre Kevin McCloud wearing a hard hat on site and warning the over-eager couple that they may have overstretched themselves. But Edward confidently told the TV presenter that they would be finished in just  months, and would spend no more than £. million. However, the project ended in disaster as the couple ended up splitting, while the family were plunged into millions of pounds of debt. But now the home has finally gone on the open market - for a whopping £M after Edward Short, , has spent a decade working on Chesil Clf House in a bid to get it up to scratch. The property featured on Channel aposs Grand Designs and was described as the saddest episode ever after it aired in October . And Mr Short hasnapost held back on what it has cost him personally, as he told thelast year: There’s no point in regrets, but obviouslyI had any idea of what it would cost the marriage and my family, I wouldn’t have done it. I had started it it’s not easy to back out of this. He added: There were quite a few days where I looked temptingly at the clf edge and thought le might be better down there, but that wouldn’t have helped anyone, would it  I couldn’t give up on that image I had of [the house].”  But despite all the problems, Edward remained adamant he would finish - and now estate agent Knight Frank has now announced the sale of the main house and its annexe known as The Eye. The estate agent described it as one of the most impressive waterfront homes on the North Devon coast. It comprises of five bedrooms and bathrooms, four reception rooms, a sauna and a cellar. The property will also include the three-bedroom studio annexe known as The Eye and double garage.  A Knight Frank spokesperson added: Chesil Clf House is positioned on a three-acre site between surfers’ paradise Saunton Sands backed by the impressive UNESCO Biosphere Reserve of Braunton Burrows, and the idyllic cove of Croyde, beyond which sits National Trust-owned Baggy Point. “Not only does the property boast high design and build quality, it also has a south-facing position and an ease of access to the water with a private beach and foreshore.” Christopher Bailey, Head of National Waterfront, Knight Frank, added: “Chesil Clf House will be the most signicant coastal property to come to the open market in the West Country for many years.  “It is iconic in the true meaning of the word and there is nothing  to compare it to on the market right now. “It certainly sits at the very top of the national coastal waterfront market and I have no doubt it will attract keen interest globally.” Edward said earlier the time was right to move on. He added: I’ll always be proud to have finished this. I owe it to my family to have a real end result, but the time has come to move on. I will have achieved what I set out to do, never deviating from the plans, and for that I’ll always be proud. The house has been anchored into the bed rock of the clf, painstakingly engineered to a level that leaves no possibility for erosional hazard. Edward said he had no option but to sell it to cover the large amount of money he had to borrow. He added: These past ten years have been a marathon slog - and I have got used to being a millionaire in debt. Iaposve accepted the only way forward is to finish and sell it. news weird-news my-boyfriends-ex-left-make-"TikTok user discovers makeup from her boyfriends exByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has left people shocked after she revealed how she still uses make-up that her boyfriendaposs ex left behind.While many people would be upset at the thought of finding anything belonging to their beauaposs old flame, TikTok user @friskycait was thrilled.In a recent video, that has since gone viral with more than , views, Cait shared what she found in her boyfriend’s room and insists that she isn’t bothered and is actually pleased about the find. In it, she could be seen applying the Benefit Bene Tint Rose Tinted Lip  Cheek Stain - the one that belonged to her boyfriendaposs ex.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Cait said: To the girl before me that left this in my boyfriendaposs room. Queen. My fav tint. Since being posted, the video has received more than , likes and  comments from people who couldnapost work outthis was a joke or not, but Cait assured them it wasnapost. One person said: How are you not crying. Another added: Why would you use it. A third commented: God, my nightmare. Someone  was grossed out by the revelation: Ayo so ur just using a used applicator  to which Cait replied saying: I kiss him so same applicator as well. But a few people wondered whether she was being cheated on. One person said: The way she probably left it for you to find. You’re getting cheated on babes, commented a second person. Others shared funny stories of their own, as one person said: When I first met my boyfriend I found a scrunchy in his room and I stole it to put in a dumpster. Lol I found this straightener blow dryer thing at my manaposs house yesterday and legit used it haha. Thanks, hookups and old girlfriends, added another.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: my mums demanding paid looking
story: My mum’s demanding to be paid for looking after her grandson - Im hurtA woman took to Mumsnet to ask users whether or not she should be paying her mum money to babysit her son but some people thought it was "odd" that she hadnt beenHer mum moved in with her and her husband to help with their baby Image: Getty Images Image SourceByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman has hit out at her mum after she demanded to be paid for looking after her grandson.The anonymous woman explained her situation on Mumsnet, where she said that her mum has been living with her and her husband for the last year to help out with their baby.She has helped us out a lot by looking after my son when both me and my husband are in a pinch, she wrote. This has been great and much appreciated and at first I thought she was happy to help out because she expressed how much she wanted a grandchild before my son was born. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Although the arrangement had been working well, the womanaposs mum has now started asking for money to babysit. She has recently said she now wants to be paid for looking after my son and is upset that we haven’t paid her at all, she continued. She did not indicate that she expected payment in the first place. The woman said that her mum pays no rent or money towards food and amenities, and has even gone on a few holidays with them as well, so she couldnapost help but be surprised when her mum brought up payment. If anything I’m more hurt that she feels this way, as my point of view us paying her feels like a transaction and not the fact that it’s her grandchild, the woman continued. I’m more than happy to pay for expenses that she might incur for looking after my son but in our case, there isnapost any because she lives with us. Butshe wants payment then I might as well take my son to a nursery when Iaposm back at work. The post sparked a debate among users as they argued who was in the wrong. Many people in the comments said her mum was unreasonable to ask for money when she lives in the house rent-free, as one person said: It seems strange that she’s asking to be paid for childcare when she’s living rent-free as a family member. Another said: Say yes - happy to pay you. At the same time, we set up the rental agreement for us housing you subsidising your living expenses and then we can knock it off what you owe us…! But others thought it was odd that she hadnapost been paying her. You assumed she was happy to do it for free infor room and board, one person wrote. Now you know this isnapost the case she will, of course, want to pay rent and you will, in turn, pay her for the childcare. While someone  said: I would pay her. It is hard looking after a -month-old all day every day. I think it is odd that you donapost. But a third person said: This type of request doesn’t come from thin air. She either feels like you’re using her and so has asked for payment to end the arrangement, or you or your [darling husband] may have accidentally insulted or offended her by mentioning the extras you do pay for. If she were truly happy with you and your family she would never have asked for money, so you do need to delve a bit deeper before having a go.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. story: We got engaged at six weeks - its fast but you cant put a time limit on loveMelissa and Billy Gray have gone viral on TikTok after they told their , followers how they moved in together after dating for two weeks and got engaged after sixMelissa and BillyByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Jan | commentsWhen you first get into a new relationship, everything can feel like itaposs moving at the speed of light - and thataposs probably because it is. But one couple moved a lot quicker than most as they shared their love story online.Melissa and Billy Gray, who have a joint TikTok account @thegrayys_, encouraged their , followers aposnot to let time be a limit on loveapos as they shared how they quickly fell in love.In a recent video, they revealed how quickly they fell in love, moved into a house together and got engaged, all in the space of six weeks. They explained: “So our story began on the th of August and it’s been a whirlwind of events.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. “Together after  days. House together  after weeks. Engaged at  weeks. “Don’t let time be a limit on love. “We are  months in now and everything is good. “Here’s to our forever.” At the time of writing, the video had been viewed more than . million times. Since being posted, the video has been liked more than , times and has , comments, many from people who wished the couple the best of luck in their relationship. One person said: If you know, you know! Another added: Me and my husband got engaged after two months, been together almost  years. A third commented: Leaposs too short, go for it and be happy. Someone  put: I moved in with my fella the first week we met, pregnant after  weeks,  years and  kids later we are happier than ever. But not everyone was as keen on the fast-paced relationship, as one person said: Divorce after  weeks. Another said: “I mean, it’s just logic to tell people to wait longer than  weeks into a relationship before they buy a house together. Just seems like rushing” but the couple confirmed “We rent, not brought  However, we are this year... Yes.” The couple also added: We privately rent and tenancy is in both our names. Everything is :. The couple also added: We privately rent and tenancy is in both our names. Everything is :.” Melissa revealed just how much she appreciates her husband and said: “I don’t thank this man enough for all he’s done for me. “He really did save me, he makes me laugh from the minute I wake up, to the minute I fall asleep. “This man has made me feel worthy of love and has made me become a better being.”Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news woman-mortied-after-ordering-boohoo-"TikToker shares hilarious results from BooHoo dress orderByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Online shopping is great, but the one downsize is that every now and then you might get an item of clothing that looks absolutely nothing like it did on the website. Weaposve all been there.But, while most of us have experienced the heartache of buying an out for a night out and it ending up being slightly too big or slightly too small - one womanaposs shopping disaster is in a league of its own. Kara Hall decided to treat herself to a plunging black sequinned wrap dress from Boohoo for her New Yearaposs Eve night out, and it happened to be an absolute bargain at just £... or so she thought. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. When the dress arrived and Kara tried it on, she released it wasnapost just plunging - it actually didnapost even cover the majority of her body.Taking to TikTok from the handle @karahall, Kara asked: What do I do  before adding in the comments section: Raise your handyou’ve been personally victimised by Boohoo Judging by the comments section, it seems like an awful lot of people were raising their hands, as dozens of TikTok users revealed they had also ordered the exact same dress and found the same fault. Nooo way, I ordered this and it looked the exact same on me, I was mortied. I had to send it back, one TikTok user commented, while another added: Omg I bought this too and sent it back for the exact same reason! Fortunately, Kara confirmed she had been able to alter the dress herself in the comments section, meaning it wasnapost a complete waste and she didnapost find herself without a New Yearaposs Eve outfit.
